title: error with having `torch` as a requirement for travis-ci builds
body_html:
Collecting torch (from -r requirements.txt (line 4))
  Downloading torch-0.1.tar.gz (286kB)
    100% |################################| 286kB 1.9MB/s 
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<string>", line 20, in <module>
      File "/tmp/pip-build-cDqZB1/torch/setup.py", line 12, in <module>
        from tools.setup_helpers.env import check_env_flag
    ImportError: No module named setup_helpers.env
    Complete output from command python setup.py egg_info:
    Traceback (most recent call last):
    
      File "<string>", line 20, in <module>
    
      File "/tmp/pip-build-cDqZB1/torch/setup.py", line 12, in <module>
    
        from tools.setup_helpers.env import check_env_flag
    
    ImportError: No module named setup_helpers.env
    
    ----------------------------------------
    Command "python setup.py egg_info" failed with error code 1 in /tmp/pip-build-cDqZB1/torch
The command "pip install -r requirements.txt" failed and exited with 1 during .

I see that pytorch (under the package name torch) is available on PyPI now. However, I don't seem to be able to properly install it using travis-ci.

Any suggestions?

```

```

I see that `pytorch` (under the package name `torch`) is available on PyPI now. However, I don't seem to be able to properly install it using travis-ci.

Any suggestions?
